'''Miltank''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ミルタンク''' ''Miltank'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It is not known to [[Evolution|evolve]] into or from any other Pokémon, but it is considered to be a counterpart of {{p|Tauros}}.

==Biology==
Miltank is a bipedal, bovine Pokémon, which can only be female. Its body is mostly pink, with a yellow belly and black, angular markings along its back. A black hood-like marking surrounds its face with a pink, triangular mark on its forehead. There are two small horns on top of its head. It has large, blue eyes, a black nose, and a wide mouth, as well as long, black, floppy ears with yellow insides. Miltank has a yellow udder with four pink teats. All four of its limbs end in black, cloven hooves, and its long tail is tipped with a black sphere.

Until [[Generation VI]], Miltank was the [[Signature move|only known Pokémon]] that could learn {{m|Milk Drink}}. The milk that it produces is sweet and very nutritious, and can be used to [[Drink#Moomoo Milk|heal Pokémon]] and ill or weary humans. The taste and nutrition of its milk improves with the quality of the pastures it lives in. It can produce over five gallons of milk per day, which in turn can be turned into yogurt or enjoyed unchanged by children and adults alike. Miltank lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands}}, and is also raised on farms.

==In the anime==
[[File:Sima Miltank.png|thumb|left|220px|Miltank in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Whitney's Miltank]]====
[[Whitney]]'s {{TP|Whitney|Miltank}} debuted in ''[[EP158|A Goldenrod Opportunity]]'' and ''[[EP159|A Dairy Tale Ending]]'', where it was used in a Gym battle against Ash's Pokémon.

====Other====
[[Whitney]]'s uncle, [[Milton]], also has multiple Miltank at his farm in ''[[EP159|A Dairy Tale Ending]]''.

A Miltank appeared in ''[[EP207|Got Miltank?]]'', where it was guarding a Pokémon-exclusive area.

Four Miltank appeared in ''[[DP062|Tanks for the Memories!]]''. One was under {{OBP|Autumn|DP062}}'s ownership, nicknamed "Ilta" (ルータン ''Rūtan''), two were under {{OBP|Spring and Summer|DP062|Summer}}'s, and another one was under {{OBP|Spring and Summer|DP062|Spring}}'s.

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Miltank were seen at [[Professor Oak's Laboratory]] in ''[[EP225|Bulbasaur... the Ambassador!]]''.

A Miltank appeared on the side of a truck in ''[[EP259|Entei at Your Own Risk]]''.

{{jo|Harrison}} has a Miltank, but she has only been used to quell an argument between [[Ash's Bulbasaur]] and {{AP|Squirtle}} and [[Vincent's Meganium]] and {{p|Azumarill}} during the [[Silver Conference]] in ''[[EP268|Tie One On!]]''.

[[Solana]] enlisted the help of a {{pkmn2|wild}} Miltank in ''[[AG171|Pokémon Ranger: Deoxys Crisis]]''.

Several Miltank were seen outside of a [[Pokémon Center]] in ''[[BW124|Danger, Sweet as Honey!]]''.

Multiple Miltank appeared in ''[[SM011|Young Kiawe Had a Farm!]]'', where they were among the Pokémon on [[Paniola Ranch]]. Two of them reappeared in ''[[SM030|The Ol' Raise and Switch!]]'', where they were frightened by two fighting {{p|Tauros}}.

A Miltank appeared on a video screen at [[Aether Paradise]] in ''[[SM049|Mission: Total Recall!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Whitney Miltank Golden Boys.png|thumb|150px|Miltank in [[Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys]]]]
[[File:Whitney Miltank Heal Bell Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Miltank in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Whitney's Miltank|Mil-Mil}}
{{TP|Whitney|Miltank}}, nicknamed Mil Mil, is seen as [[Whitney]]'s main Pokémon powerhouse, which she used in a bike race with {{adv|Gold}} in ''[[PS105|Smeargle Smudge]]''. She later took her to the [[Mahogany Gym]] with [[DJ Mary]] and her crew in ''[[PS143|Irked Igglybuff and Curmudgeonly Cleffa]]'', and used her to fight a moving sculpture that they believed was {{p|Suicune}}, where she failed even with an ice floor-augmented {{m|Rollout}} attack, and had to team up with [[Pryce]] to win. She later uses her in the [[Pokémon League]] Gym Leader tournament against [[Misty]], but her {{p|Starmie}} takes her out with ease.

In the [[Moomoo Farm]], [[Eusine]] feigns healing a Miltank in ''[[PS127|Miltank Melee]]'', with other Miltank out in the fields. They are seen again in ''[[PS128|Indubitably Ditto]]'', sleeping, having been affected by {{DL|Crystal (Adventures)|Parasee}}'s Spore. In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' the couple from Moomoo Farm sent multiple of their Miltank to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

A Trainer's Miltank appeared in ''[[PS421|Clobbering Claydol]]''.

In ''[[PAXY01|An X-cuse to Come Out and Play]]'', a Miltank is seen with her trainer as Yveltal and Xerneas destroy [[Vaniville Town]] during their battle.

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
{{main|Whitney's Miltank}}
One of [[Whitney]]'s main Pokémon in [[Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys]] is a Miltank.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
{{OBP|Red|Pocket Monsters}} was revealed to have a Miltank in ''[[PM067|A Finger Lickin' Battle!]]''.

{{OBP|Giovanni|Pocket Monsters}} stole five Miltank during ''[[PM068|Messing up the Farm!!]]''. {{OBP|Professor Oak|Pocket Monsters}} was able to rescue them from Giovanni and takes them under his control.

Whitney also has a {{TP|Whitney|Miltank}} as shown in ''[[PM084|Fierce Battle Between Clefairy and Clefable]]''.

A Miltank appeared in [[PMDP53]] and ''[[PMHGSS01|Participate in the Pokéathlon!!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Miltank can be seen as a counterpart to {{p|Tauros}}. Both are bovine-like Pokémon with the same base stat total. While Miltank is a female-only species, Tauros is a male-only species.
* Despite not being associated with a certain group, both Miltank and Tauros are listed in the same [[Pokédex]] page in {{g|Sun and Moon}} and {{g|Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon}}. The same trait is true with {{p|Oranguru}} and {{p|Passimian}}.
* Miltank's Silver and FireRed Pokédex entries imply that Miltank gives live birth like real-world mammals, despite the fact that Pokémon reproduce via {{pkmn|Egg}}s.

===Origin===
Miltank is based on dairy cows. It shares many traits with {{wp|Jersey cattle}} and {{wp|Holstein Friesian cattle}}.

====Name origin====
Miltank is a combination of ''{{wp|milk}}'' and ''tank'' (a storage container for liquid). ''Tank'' may also refer to its tank-like defense stats.
